Package model

Class DrawingTool

java.lang.Object
model.DrawingTool
Direct Known Subclasses:
Brush, Circle, Eraser, Fill, Rectangle, Select, Square, TextTool, Triangle
public abstract class DrawingTool extends Object
Abstract base class for drawing tools. This abstract class serves as the foundation for all drawing tools in the application, providing a common structure and managing properties like color and size. Subclasses must implement the 'draw' method.
Version:
1.6
Author:
Doom Al Rajhi

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public abstract void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, double x, double y)
      Abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses. This method is responsible for drawing on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      canvas - The canvas on which to draw.
      x - The x-coordinate of the drawing point.
      y - The y-coordinate of the drawing point.

    • drawDragged

      public abstract void drawDragged(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, double x, double y)
      Abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses. This method is responsible for handling continuous drawing as the mouse is dragged.
      Parameters:
      canvas - The canvas on which to draw.
      x - The x-coordinate of the current drawing point.
      y - The y-coordinate of the current drawing point.

    • getColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getColor()
      Get the color currently set for the drawing tool.
      Returns:
      The color of the drawing tool.

    • setColor

      public void setColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Set the color for the drawing tool.
      Parameters:
      color - The new color to set.

    • getSize

      public double getSize()
      Get the size or thickness of the drawing tool's stroke.
      Returns:
      The size of the drawing tool's stroke.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(double size)
      Set the size or thickness of the drawing tool's stroke.
      Parameters:
      size - The new size to set.

    • moveSelected

      public abstract javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas moveSelected(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicscontext, double x, double y)
      Abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses. This method is responsible for handling the movement of a selected drawing element.
      Parameters:
      graphicscontext - The GraphicsContext for drawing.
      x - The new x-coordinate for the selected element.
      y - The new y-coordinate for the selected element.
      Returns:
      A Canvas object representing the updated drawing after the movement.

    • mouseReleased

      public abstract javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas mouseReleased(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double x, double y)
      Abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses. This method is called when the mouse button is released during a drawing operation.
      Parameters:
      gc - The GraphicsContext for drawing.
      x - The x-coordinate where the mouse button was released.
      y - The y-coordinate where the mouse button was released.
      Returns:
      A Canvas object representing the updated drawing after the mouse release.
